questions.question_text:
Your company has a Microsoft 365 subscription.
A user invites an external user to join a Microsoft Teams meeting by using a Microsoft Outlook meeting invitation.
The external user cannot join the meeting.
You need to ensure that all external users can join Microsoft Team meetings.
What should you do from the Microsoft Teams admin center?

choices.D: Edit the live events policy and set Who can join live events to Everyone.
choices.C: Edit the global meeting policy and set Allow scheduling private meetings to On.
choices.B: Edit the Meeting settings and set Anonymous users can join a meeting to On.
choices.A: From Guest access in the Org-wide settings, set Allow guest access in Microsoft Teams to On.

discussion.content: Ans is B : Go to the Meeting Settings Policy. This question came in the recent exam

B:Correct 
A : allows the user access in teams , the question is limited to allowing user to join a teams meeting
c: irrelevant 
d. there is no such setting in that menu

Selected Answer: B
Go to the Meeting Settings Policy.

Correct answer is A, although org-wide settings as such does not exist anymore. Its under guest access now. This has to be set to On. Otherwise no external user can join whatever, even when the "anonymus users can join a meeting" is set to On. Besides: this is not an anonymus user, since the one is invited by email.

Second part of answer is correct and definitely HR 

" The MailNickName parameter specifies the alias for the associated Office 365 Group. This value will be used for the mail enabled object and will be used as PrimarySmtpAddress for this Office 365 Group" 

As per:

https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/powershell/module/teams/new-team?view=teams-ps
since the question states 'join' and not 'access' teams and channels, it is clearly B
Correct answer: B

questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT -
Your company has a Microsoft 365 subscription that uses Phone System.
You need to configure the environment to meet the following requirements:
✑ Only users in the company's sales department must have Call forwarding and simultaneous ringing to external phone numbers set to Off.
✑ Only users in the marketing department must have Inbound calls can be routed to call groups set to Off.
✑ All outbound calls to the PSTN must use the auto attendant number as the caller ID.
What is the minimum number of policies that should be created? To answer, select the appropriate options in the answer area.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
Hot Area:
//IMG//

discussion.content: No need to create a new Caller ID Policy. Global (already existing) policy can be changed to provide Auto Attendant service number for outgoing calls. I think correct answer is 0,0,2.

comments.content:
Best practice is to create a new policy when deviating from the Global policy (only applying settings there if it really should affect ALL users, and otherwise leaving it at default).

This also ensures that the Global policy is viable for as many people as possible and you don't have to create one for those that do not need this setting.
So 1,0,2 would be my choice.

Caller ID policies: 1
This policy will ensure that all outbound calls to the PSTN use the auto attendant number as the caller ID, fulfilling the third requirement.
Call Park Policies: 0
No call park policies are necessary for the specified requirements.
Calling Policies: 2
One calling policy will be needed for the sales department to restrict call forwarding and simultaneous ringing to external numbers.
Another calling policy will be needed for the marketing department to disable inbound call routing to call groups.

The above answer is correct. It is 1,0,2 as you will need to create a caller ID policy for making Auto attendant number as caller ID, as by default it shows the number of the Teams user.
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/caller-id-policies

If this was the case then why in Teams does it state "You can use the Global (Org-wide default) policy and customize it or create one or more custom calling policies for people that have phone numbers in your organization." 
I think it's fine to use the global default and its looking for the minimum, so it's 0,0,2.

As industry best practices, create a custom policy to override an existing default global policy rather than editing or modifying the defaults. Exception is if the condition applies to everyone in the organization.
MS are saying it's possible, but they are not recommending it

Within the TAC, it says that "You can use the Global (Org-wide default) policy and customize it or create a custom policy that provides an alternate number to display, or to block any number from being displayed." So even Microsoft recommends to modify the Global policy. The answer is 0,0,2.
Fair enough, but org-wide policies should be intact (ideally)
Agree, Global Caller ID is required to change. The important word in question is "created". Global CallerID already exists.
Maybe one can say a policy is still required when you edit the global policy to 1 caller ID policy would be required in that sense.

discussion.content: IMO 1,0,2 is correct. The key word is "should": do you really need to create caller ID policy? No. SHOULD YOU do it? YES, that's MS best practice, "thou will not touch global policy unless it's global" :)

comments.content: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/call-park-and-retrieve#configure-call-park-and-retrieve

discussion.content:
The question is "what is the *minimum number*..."!
 and not "what is best practise" or "how many can/should you create".

Because of "*ALL* outbound calls..." -> it affects ALL users and therefore you can just configure the Global org-wide policy. There is *NO NEED* to create a third policy.

Again, the questions about the minimum number of policies required to achieve the goal. And the minimum number is 2 calling policies.
Was on test on 22.08.2022
On Test 18.01.22

Everyone keeps saying how you're not supposed to touch the global policies unless it's a global change. What part of "All outbound calls to the PSTN must use the auto attendant number as the caller ID." is not global? ALL OUTBOUND CALLS. Answer is 0, 0, 2.
Demo on plurasight training page suggests the same.

Answer - 0,0,2
Outbound caller ID - There are three options available for outbound PSTN caller ID:
The telephone number assigned to the user, which is the default.
A telephone number that is classified as a service and toll-free number in your Calling Plans telephone number inventory. It is usually assigned to an organizational auto attendant or call queue.
Set to anonymous.

All question states "All outbound calls" & "minimum number of policies" - to change the setting for all users, you change adjust the global policy. You create new Calling ID policies for different departments, eg Helpdesk, show service number rather than the individual number. 

https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/how-can-caller-id-be-used-in-your-organization

All outbound calls to the PSTN must use the auto attendant number as the caller ID.
So the Global policy can work. It is not limited for any department. No new callerID policy will be needed. 
0, 0 , 2
Correct

comments.content: "All outbound calls to the PSTN must use the auto attendant number as the caller ID." - hence ALL CALLS need to go out replacing the caller ID, so of course you use the global policy, it's a global change when all users are involved. It's 0,0,2.

you would need to change the number of the Global only not modify the policy,
i would now go with 0,0,2
don't touch Global if not All users are affected (Best Practice Microsoft). So I will go with 1,0,2
I think this is correct taking in to account the Minimum number of policies that should be created

discussion.content: 0,0,2 - Global caller ID policy can to be modified, no need to Create

choices.C: Create a new caller ID policy and set Replace caller ID to Anonymous.
choices.D: Create a new caller ID policy and set Replace caller ID to Service number.
choices.A: Create a new calling policy and set Make private calls to On.
choices.B: Create a new calling policy and set Inbound calls can be routed to call groups to On.

questions.question_text:
Your company uses Phone System.
A group of users make outbound calls on behalf of the company's billing department.
You need to ensure that when the users make the outbound calls, their numbers are replaced by a phone number that is associated to an existing call queue.
What should you do first?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
correct

Answer is D
D is correct, yes.

Selected Answer: D
Correct

Selected Answer: D
Correct
D is correct
Yes - D is correct

choices.A: Modify the caller ID properties of User5.
choices.D: Assign an app setup policy to User5.
choices.C: Assign a SIP address to User5.
choices.B: Assign a Phone System license to User5.

questions.question_text:
Your company has a Microsoft 365 subscription.
A user named User5 cannot establish call from Microsoft Teams.
You review the Microsoft Teams client for User5 and discover that the dial pad is unavailable.
Other users at the company can establish calls successfully.
You need to ensure that User5 can establish calls.
Which two actions should you perform? Each correct answer represents part of the solution.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

discussion.content: Assign Phone System License and Enable user for Enterprise Voice
B and E is the solution here
B and E is the correct answer.

Selected Answer: BE
B & E are the correct answers
E should be automatically done when assigned the phone system license

The user hasn't assigned a Teams license.
The user hasn't assigned a Calling Plan.
The user hasn't enabled Enterprise Voice.
The user is in Islands mode.
The OnlineVoiceRoutingPolicy value isn't set correctly for the user.

comments.content:
Indeed from the training....If a user has reported that the dial pad is missing from the Calls screen and they cannot make outbound calls, check the following:

Does the user have a Teams license?
Does the user have a Calling plan assigned?
Is Enterprise Voice enabled for the user?
Is the user in Islands mode?
Is the OnlineVoiceRoutingPolicy value set correctly for this user?

discussion.content: I'm not sure if you're aware, but the solution is B and E.
just to join the bandwagon, B & E is the solution here.
B and E is correct
B & E could be easily tested and it is right. So it is all about licensing
B & E 100% correct
B and E ..need to be selected
This question was there in exam. i just cleared my MS-700. This is a very good site infact examtopic is doing a great job. Thanks

comments.content: Do you know what answer was chosen for the exam? Just E or was it B and E?
What was the correct answer? B&E? Or just E
B and E. Question says two actions.

discussion.content: E will fail if B isn't done. So, yes. Check Phone System License is applied, then enable for EV

BE
A: This will just adjust the caller ID number.
C: MS Teams does not directly use SIP. It is only used when it needs to route to say a conference phone. https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-teams/does-teams-dial-pad-support-sip-uri-dialing-for-non-teams/m-p/386344
D: This just adds the app within the Teams app.
B & E are correct answers. We need to first assign "Phone system License" and then enable "Enterprise Voice" feature via power shell on that user account

Which two actions should you perform? Each correct answer represents part of the solution.
B + E
B & E correct answer.
B & E are the Answers here..It needs both Enterprise Voice and Phone System License

comments.content: Yes. B & E.

discussion.content: Two actions?

Selected Answer: B
Correct. TAC -> Meetings -> Meeting settings -> Email invitation section.
Correct
correct

questions.question_text:
Your company has a Microsoft 365 subscription.
You need to customize meeting invitation emails to include the company logo.
What should you do in the Microsoft Teams admin center?

choices.D: From Meeting policies, modify the Global (Org-wide default) policy.
choices.B: From Meeting settings, modify the Email invitation settings.
choices.A: From Teams settings, modify the Email integration settings.
choices.C: From Meeting policies, create a new meeting policy and assign the policy.
